lines.content: JavaBot is a simple command-line task manager written in Java. It supports creating, managing, and persisting different types of tasks such as **To-Dos**, **Deadlines**, and **Events**. The project is built with Gradle, tested with JUnit 5 + Mockito, and packaged with the Shadow plugin.
- List all tasks in your checklist
- Tasks are automatically saved to disk via `SavingService`
- Tasks are reloaded at startup with `LoadingService`
- Friendly messages for invalid input, missing indices, or bad date formats
- Custom parsing with `DateTimeUtil` to handle date/time input
- Mockito for mocking dependencies and verifying behavior
- Coverage for services, storage, and core task logic
### The runnable JAR will be in build/libs/javabot.jar:
* This serves as the entry point for the JavaBot application.
* This class initializes the BotService which handles the core functionality of the bot.
* Contains constant values used throughout the bot application.
* The {@code BotConstants} class provides a centralized location for defining
* constant values such as command keywords, file paths, and formatting strings.
* This helps maintain consistency and makes it easier to manage these values

* Represents a checklist that manages a list of tasks.
* The {@link CheckList} class provides methods to handle and manipulate a list of {@link Task} objects.
* Adds a task to the checklist.
* @param task The {@link Task} to be added to the checklist.
* Removes a task from the checklist by its index.
* @param index The index of the task to be removed (0-indexed).
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the index is out of range.
throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException("Invalid task number! Please provide a valid task number to delete.");
System.out.println(INDENT + "Roger. The following task is removed:\n"
+ INDENT + removedTask.toString() + "\n" + INDENT + "You now have " + this.getSize() + " tasks in your list.");
* Retrieves a task from the checklist by its index.
* @param index The index of the task to be retrieved (0-indexed).
* @return The {@link Task} at the specified index.
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the index is out of range.
* Checks if the checklist is empty.
* @return {@code true} if the checklist is empty, {@code false} otherwise.
* Gets the number of tasks in the checklist.
* Prints all tasks in the checklist with their respective indices.
* If the checklist is empty, it notifies the user accordingly.
System.out.println(INDENT + "Uh oh...You currently have no tasks in your list! Add some tasks to get started!");
System.out.println(INDENT + "Certainly! Here are your inputs thus far:");
System.out.printf(INDENT + "You currently have %d items in your list!%n", this.getSize());
* Marks the task at the specified index as completed.
* @param index The index of the task to be marked as completed (0-based).
System.out.println(INDENT + "The following task has already been marked as done: " + task.getDescription());
System.out.println(INDENT + "Well done! I'll mark it as done for you.\n" + INDENT
* Marks the task at the specified index as not completed.
* @param index The index of the task to be marked as not completed (0-based).
System.out.println(INDENT + "The following task has already been marked as not done: " + task.getDescription());
System.out.println(INDENT + "Okay! I'll mark it as not done for you.\n" + INDENT
* Searches for tasks containing the specified keyword and prints them.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for in task descriptions.
System.out.println(INDENT + "No matching tasks found for the keyword: " + keyword);
System.out.println(INDENT + "Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
* Utility class for converting between String representations of dates and LocalDateTime objects.
* The {@link DateTimeUtil} class provides static methods to convert date strings in specific formats
* to {@link LocalDateTime} objects and vice versa. It also handles formatting and parsing exceptions.

*
  • Output format: "MMM dd yyyy, h:mm a" (e.g., "Jan 01 1990, 6:00 PM")
* Converts a date string in the format "dd/MM/yyyy HHmm" to a {@link LocalDateTime} object.
* @param dateStr the date string to convert.
* @throws DateTimeParseException if the input string is not in the expected format.
public static LocalDateTime convertStringToLocalDate(String dateStr) throws DateTimeParseException {
* Converts a {@link LocalDateTime} object to a formatted date string in the format "MMM dd yyyy, h:mm a".
* @param date the LocalDateTime object to convert.
* Converts a formatted date string in the format "MMM dd yyyy, h:mm a" to a {@link LocalDateTime} object.
* If the input string is null or equals "No date given", the method returns null.
* @param dateStr the formatted date string to convert.
* @return {@code LocalDateTime}  the corresponding LocalDateTime object, or null if input is invalid.
* @throws DateTimeParseException if the input string is not in the expected format.
public static LocalDateTime convertFormattedStringDateToLocalDate(String dateStr) throws DateTimeParseException {
return LocalDateTime.parse(dateStr, DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy, h:mm a"));
* Represents the main service of the bot application.
* The BotService class extends {@link Service} class and provides implementations for starting and ending
* the service. It handles user input, processes commands, and manages a checklist of tasks.
* Executes the main service loop, handling user input and processing commands.
* The method continuously reads user input from the console, processes commands such as adding tasks,
* marking tasks as completed, unmarking tasks, deleting tasks, and listing all tasks. The loop continues
* until the user inputs the exit command.
* @throws IllegalStateException    if an invalid task type is provided.
* @throws NullPointerException     if task creation fails due to null values.
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if an invalid task index is provided for marking or unmarking.
* @throws IOException              if an I/O error occurs during service execution.
protected void executeService() throws IllegalStateException, NullPointerException,

* Ends the bot service by displaying a farewell message.
* Service class responsible for loading tasks from a file into a checklist.
* The {@link LoadingService} reads tasks from a specified file, parses them, and adds them to a Checklist object.
* It supports different types of tasks including EventTask, ToDosTask, and DeadlineTask.
* The {@link LoadingService} class extends {@link Service} class and provides implementations for starting and ending
* Executes the loading service by reading tasks from a storage file and adding them to the {@link Checklist}.
* This method reads each line from the file, parses it into a {@link Task} object,
* and adds it to the {@link Checklist}.
* If the checklist is empty after loading, it notifies the user.
* @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs while reading the file.
System.out.println("There are no tasks in your checklist.");
System.out.println("Tasks have been loaded successfully\n" + "type 'list' to view your tasks.");
* @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs during service startup.

* Service class responsible for saving tasks from a checklist to a file.
* The {@link SavingService} writes tasks from a {@link Checklist} object to a specified filepath.
* It ensures that the tasks are saved in a readable format, with each task on a new line.
* The {@link SavingService} class extends {@link Service} class and provides implementations for starting and ending
* Executes the saving service by writing tasks from the {@link Checklist} to a storage file.
* This method creates or overwrites the specified file and writes each task from the checklist
* into the file, ensuring that each task is on a new line. It also includes a header indicating
* that these are the saved tasks.
* @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs while writing to the file.
* Starts the saving service by initializing the file path and executing the service.
* This method prints a message indicating the file path where tasks will be saved,
* and then calls the {@link #executeService()} method to perform the actual saving of tasks.
* @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs while starting the service.
* Ends the saving service by printing a confirmation message.
* This method is called after the tasks have been successfully saved to the file,
* and it notifies the user that the tasks have been saved.
* Abstract class representing a generic service with lifecycle methods.
* The {@link Service} class defines the structure for services that have a defined lifecycle,
* including methods to start, execute, and end the service.
* Subclasses must provide implementations for these abstract methods.
protected abstract void executeService() throws Exception;
protected abstract void startService() throws Exception;
* Represents a deadline task which has a description and an end date.
* A DeadlineTask object contains a description of the task and an end date.
* It extends the {@link Task} class to include a deadline for the task.
private static final String TASK_TYPE = DEADLINE_TASK_TYPE;
* Returns a String representation of the task which includes its description, completion as a symbol,
* @return {@code String}  a string representation of DeadlineTask.
* Represents an event task which has a description, start date, and end date.
* An EventTask object contains a description of the task, a start date, and an end date.
* It extends the {@link Task} class to include start and end timings of a given event.
private static final String TASK_TYPE = EVENT_TASK_TYPE;
public EventTask(String description, LocalDateTime startDate, LocalDateTime endDate) {
* Returns a String representation of the task which includes its description, completion as a symbol,
* Example: "[E][ ] read book (from: Jan 01 1990, 12:00 pm to: Jan 01 1990, 1:00 pm)"
* @return {@code String}  a string representation of EventTask.
* A Task object contains a description of the task and a boolean flag indicating whether the task is completed.
* Gets the description of this task.
* @return {@code String}  the description of the task.
/** Gets whether the task is completed.
* @return {@code boolean}  true if the task is completed, false otherwise.
* Toggles the completion status of the task.
* If the task is completed, it will be marked as incomplete, and vice versa.
* Returns a String representation of the task which includes its description and completion as a symbol.
* The completion symbol is "[]" if the task is completed and "[ ]" if it is not.
* Example: "[ ] read book" or "[] write code"
* @return {@code String}  a string representation of the task.
* Represents a to-do task which has a description.
* A ToDosTask object contains a description of the task.
* It extends the {@link Task} class to represent a basic to-do task.
private static final String TASK_TYPE = TODO_TASK_TYPE;
